greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between smallest square >= n and n.
comment: The greedy inverse (sequence of the smallest k such that a(k)=n) starts 0, 3, 2, 6, 5, 11, 10, 18, 17, 27, 26, 38, 37, 51, 50, ... and appears to be given by A010000 and A002522, interleaved. - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 17 2014
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f.: (-x^2 + (x-x^2)*Sum_{m>=1} (1+2*m)*x^(m^2))/(1-x)^2. This sum is related to Jacobi Theta functions. - _Robert Israel_, Nov 17 2014
maple: A068527:=n->ceil(sqrt(n))^2-n; seq(A068527(n), n=0..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 11 2014
program: (MAGMA) [ Ceiling(Sqrt(n))^2-n : n in [0..50] ]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 11 2014
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 21 2002
